name: citizenM hotel Amsterdam Airport

reviews.text: Comfortable hotel with small rooms with a radical design (Step into one for the first time and you will know what I mean!). Location is 5 mins walk from the airport so very convenient for an early morning departure. The lobby and common areas are very modern and great for hanging out and meeting fellow travellers if you want.
reviews.title: Hip & Quirky, albeit a bit impractical

reviews.text: Pros :
reviews.title: LOVED THIS HOTEL!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. Free Internet
reviews.title: Location, location, location!

reviews.text: 2. Free on-demand movies
reviews.title: Greatly adjusted for a solo traveler!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3. Huge Bed
reviews.title: Groovy.

reviews.text: Thoroughly enjoyed my stay at Citizen M. The rooms, although compact, were fascinating in size, design, and technology. I particularly enjoyed the "wake up call." Amazing. The fact that you could customize the room to your tastes and preferences added to the room's uniqueness.
reviews.title: A great place to stay in Amsterdam!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The one not-so-great feature was the breakfast. If I had to do it over again, I would not have bought it. I did not care AT ALL for the yogurt, although the danish were great. It was more of a continental breakfast at a price (9.95 Euro) that seemed as if it should have been a bit more substantial.
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But don't let that discourage you. It IS a great place and, if I'm near one again--I'll stay there.
reviews.title: Excellent room, disappointing breakfast

reviews.text: The hotel is very nice. The room is small but effective.
reviews.title: Perfect choice - for morning flights

reviews.text: The location is great, near the terminal, but it is a little bit further to walk as they mentioned.
reviews.title: will stay at CitizenM again on my next trip to Amsterdam

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had the pleasure to stay for longer time and we have come to the conclusion that of all the hotels in the world ( and we know quite a few) there is not one that matches the philosophy of pleasing the guest as well as this hotel. kudos to not only to the staff, but also to the management which obviously knows how to inspire them.
reviews.title: Citizen M puts the M into fun!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: location 3 minutes from all the shops in the schiphol arrival hall incl. *bucks,groceriestore,drugstore and bookshop.
reviews.title: Maybe not for everyone, but we loved it

reviews.text: 3 minutes from a 20minutes ride by train to the very centre of amsterdam and a 12 minutes busride to the town of amstelveen with a great shopping mall.
reviews.title: Awesome

reviews.text: a great way to start or finish a vacation or a quick business trip.
reviews.title: Made Me Smile

reviews.text: If your looking for a traditional hotel, then maybe this isn't the place for you. But we loved it! The decor and atmosphere were awesome, and the location was perfect for our early morning flight.
reviews.title: Fabulous place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great hotel concept with modern unique facilities at a great value price. The bed was fabulous, great flat screen TV, wonderful programmable mood lighting as well as new modern shower and toilet facilities. Great experience. Would highly recommend. Walked out of Schipol Airport to the hotel across the street.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay/Great Value

likes.liked: — Clean, comfortable, reasonable, free internet access
likes.disliked: — closet space limited for hanging clothes

reviews.text: This is simply the most wicked place ever. Tons of famous design interiors, hi tech devices all around, customizable morning alarms (i woke up in the freaking jungle!!), room themes and lights, great Taschen books all around, tasty food snacks...the free-for-all computers at the lobby are awesome 21 inch Macs...can you believe that?
reviews.title: The future is here! And it's affordable!

reviews.text: We spent like, 30 minutes taking pictures of us seated on famous designer chairs, and played for hours with ever changing rooms' lights colour.
reviews.title: Great new hotel concept

reviews.text: This place jus plain EMBARASSES almost every other hotel I've ever been to, holiday or work.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: The lack of restaurant is really no big deal, since this is an airport hotel, and besides, only really old, crutsy lads like to eat at hotel's restaurants. If you are an old coot, the Sheraton across the street can of offer you last century's atmosphere and hospice-like comfort. At double the price, big deal, man,
reviews.title: Great!

reviews.text: If you don't mind a 20 minute train ride to get into the city, this is the place to stay in Amsterdam. I booked this hotel for less than $100 USD and it is one of the best values that I have ever received from a hotel. The check-in is amazingly quick and can be done without talking to anyone, if you choose. The computer guides you through the system; however, two guest service personnel stand by for your convenience. The lobby is beautiful. The room is small (the width of the room is the length of a kingsized bed), but it is so well laid out, you would hardly notice the size. The pod toilet is private enough that you don't feel awkward about utilizing the facility with another person in the room. The TV and the room remote control is awesome. Now, the only negative about this room...the shower. Since the pod shower only works when it is closed, it is not possible to get warm water flowing before you step into the pod. This burst of cold water from the roof of the shower is quite the wake-up. The check-out from the room is just as easy as the check-in. The hotel is immediately adjacent to the airport and it is perfect for early morning departures! Also, I will seriously consider this as my base hotel for visiting Amsterdam in the future, despite the fact that it is a brief train ride from the center of town. Note, the room can only accommodate two people who are close! Meaning, don't expect your family of four to be comfortable in one room.
reviews.title: Inexpensive Boutique-like Hotel

likes.liked: — The room remote and the check-in/out
likes.disliked: — Not being able to start the shower before stepping in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 2 weeks travelling in Europe, stayed in various hotels and citizenM was by far the best. What an awesome concept! Everything was clean, worked perfectly, HOT water, fluffy white pillows....and friendly helpful staff. Loved the moodpad! Great location right next to the airport for our early flight. Will definitely go back. Every major city in Europe should be the proud owner of a citizenM hotel....
reviews.title: Awesome hotel concept!!!

reviews.text: This is a great hotel to stay in. Easy to use and check in large and funky rooms all very well maintained and different. And given the easy access into Amsterdam worth staying in even if you are visiting the city. BUT the restaurant/canteen is very expensive indeed. Food quality good but if you want value for money bring in your own food - its even cheaper in the airport itself. That would be my only gripe. Everything else was spot on.
reviews.title: Great rooms but v expensive canteen

reviews.text: Sit on the loo, close your cylindical capsule, preselect the LED mode with your personal wireless control pad & you will be teleported to a differerent dimension in time.
reviews.title: Hotel Starship Enterprise

likes.liked: — I really do not need to chose the spectrum of my rooms lighting - but it was fun !

reviews.text: Well may be not that good; but innovative user friendy technology is used in all aspects of running this hotel.
reviews.title: Nerd Heaven - but also offering the best beds in Amsterdam

reviews.text: Simply awesome. Rooms are very small, but if you know this going in it isn't going to bother you. Need some space? Head down to one of the various lounging areas in the lobby. Loads of books to browse, cool chairs to sit on and free internet. The huge bed was comfortable for myself, my husband and 1-year old. We had two suitcases, two hand bags and the baby's car seat and pushchair and it was ok in the room. Great views of planes at Schiphol. Very short walk from airport. Beautiful design. Best of all: Affordable. Try staying at the Sheraton or anywhere else for 69 Euros!
reviews.title: Affordable, simple, cool
Good value!
reviews.text: Downsides: Signage from inside the airport. I had to ask someone where to go and then struggled to find signs. Also, if you want food at the hotel it is expensive. Then again, you are stuck here because food at the airport is expensive, too.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A very good hotel; good quality for a very good price!
reviews.title: Fun place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location for overnight stay. Immaculately clean. Very comfortable bed and pillows. Fun changing mood of the room and color of lights with computer pad. Never did figure out exactly how to set it, but had fun with trial and error. It was like staying in a futuristic movie. Very compact but efficiently laid out room. Only real complaint is that no washcloths available so had to buy one at airport. Inviting lobby, awesome lighting. Nice to have Mac computers available with free internet access.
reviews.title: Very good night rest

reviews.text: What a clever concept simple yet all you need. And what is in the room is top quality and design. Modern rooms with a very good bed, simple cleen design with ambient lighting. Although it's almost located on the runway and just a five minute walk from schiphol plaza, you don't hear a single noise. Also very nice staff and the electronic self check-in and out saves a lot of time. The breakfast sandwiches are very tasty. They are not included in the price and not cheep, but still cheeper than the €16 p.p. breakfast fee they charge at other hotels. We will most certainly use this hotel again when we need to stay a night at schiphol. It beets the rest.
reviews.title: Good value airport hotel

reviews.text: When I made the booking I was worried about the quality of the hotel as the rates are very affordable compared to the rest of the hotels in Schiphol.
reviews.title: Cheap and Chic

likes.disliked: — no privacy in the bathroom (completely open). Ok for a solo traveller.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I thought this would have been like a "Formule 1" hotel, something when you go, you feel so depressed, that you just want to run away.
reviews.title: Convenient, Clean, Comfortable

reviews.text: Although my concern I decided to give it a try.
reviews.title: Small price, great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the contrary, although rooms are quite small, it has that extra touch that makes yuo feel at ease in a spotless environment, with friendly staff, high tech amenities and affordable rates.
reviews.title: Super mod, this concept is a winner

likes.disliked: — price of food in the canteen

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The colours selection as well as the quotes spread around the hotel makes also a nice friendly atmosphere.
reviews.title: High tech - Low price at Schiphol Airport

likes.disliked: — Room seemed a little airless at times

reviews.text: Incredibly futurist hotel, full of all mod cons. Starting from the computerised checkin to the remote control operated room, this hotel is loads of fun, utterly delightful and really comfortable. The bed was super spacious, the pillows were great, the room was clean.
reviews.title: Modern, comfortable, fantastic - gadget lover's dream!

reviews.text: The downstairs lounge area is also wonderful, again, absolutely huge, very comfortable with sofas, lounge chairs, books, magazines, TVs, computers for net access and tables to work at.
reviews.title: A hotel like nothing I've ever stayed in before

reviews.text: The only negative point from my perspective is I thought the food was very expensive. That however is easily solved, it's only a two minute walk back to the airport itself where there are more than enough shops, cafes, takeaways, supermarkets etc that you can buy whatever food you want there at more normal prices.
reviews.title: Great design, but deficiences in operating pad maintenance

reviews.text: One word of warning, anyone looking for a more traditional hotel with staff in uniforms behind desks and tea trays in the room should think about finding somewhere else.
reviews.title: Small rooms, minimalist but chic

reviews.text: But for everyone else who loves playing with gadgets and wants to try a totally new hotel concept, you must visit this place at least once. I'll be going back!!
reviews.title: Not my cup of tea

description: Connected to Amsterdam Airport Schiphol, this modern budget hotel offers affordable lodging with hi-tech amenities for business and leisure travel including Wi-Fi, an LCD television, and more.
